title: Where is the mailroom?
content: The mailroom is located on the bottom (first) floor of the Union Building.

title: What are the dining hall hours?
content: The dining hall hours vary by location. Commons and Sage dining halls are open from 7 AM to 9 PM on weekdays and 9 AM to 7 PM on weekends.

title: Where can I use my meal plan?
content: Meal plans can be used at Commons, Sage, Blitman Dining Hall, and various retail locations across campus.

title: What is Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute?
content: Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI) is a private research university located in Troy, New York, known for its engineering, science, and technology programs.

title: What resources are available for academic support?
content: RPI offers various academic support resources including the Advising and Learning Assistance Center (ALAC), tutoring services, and writing assistance.

title: Where can I find the shuttle schedule?
content: The shuttle schedule is available on the RPI website and at shuttle stops around campus.

title: How do I get a parking permit?
content: Parking permits can be obtained through the Parking and Transportation office located in the Public Safety Building.

title: What should I bring to my dorm?
content: A recommended packing list includes bedding, toiletries, a desk lamp, and personal items. Check the RPI website for a full list of suggested items.

title: How do I report a maintenance issue?
content: Maintenance issues can be reported through the online maintenance request form on the RPI website (https://info.rpi.edu/facilities-management) or by contacting the residence hall staff.

title: Prohibited Items
content:
(https://sll.rpi.edu/prohibited-items)
The following items are prohibited in all Rensselaer owned and operated residence halls. Prohibited items found in residence halls may be subject to confiscation/removal by institute staff.

Decorations

Candles (whether lit or unlit), incense, scented lamps, and open flame devices of any kind
Live trees
Curtains and cloth-based or fabric tapestries/wall hangings.
Entire walls and doors may not be covered. All decorations must be affixed flat against the walls so that flames cannot reach both sides. Each wall and door cannot exceed 10% covered

Electronics (Non-Kitchen)

3D printers
Hover boards
Air Conditioners (portable or window)
Space heaters, electric blankets, sun lamps
String lights, strip lights, Battery powered string lights are allowed
Halogen lamps, and halogen light bulbs
Routers/Antennas/Satellite dishes
Wax warmers (all including lightbulb, hot plate, and plug-in mechanisms)
Soldering Irons and all appliances/tools with exposed heating elements

Electronic Components

Extension cords
Multi-tap outlet adaptors
Power strips are permitted only if they:
	are approved by a current Nationally Recognized Testing Laboratory (NRTL). Certification mark must be visible on power strip
	have a visible and functioning "grounded" and "protected" light
	have a visible reset switch (must be labeled reset)
	have no movable parts
	are plugged directly into a wall outlet. Power strips cannot be connected to another power strip/desk outlet ("daisy chain" or "piggy-backing")

Kitchen Appliances/Cooking

Appliances that are not approved by a current Nationally Recognized Testing Laboratory (NRTL). Certification mark must be visible on the appliance.
Appliances that contain an exposed heating element are not permitted. This includes, but is not limited to, hot plates, crock pots, Instant Pots, air fryers, George Foreman grills, rice cookers, electric skillets, or any appliances without a thermostat/automatic shut off. Toasters ovens are not permitted in any area.
Pop-up toasters are permitted in kitchens. Automatic shut-off coffee/tea makers, and microwaves ARE permitted.
Hibachis, other open fire grills, charcoal, and gas/propane grills.
Kerosene, gasoline, butane, or other flammable liquids.
Refrigerators and micro-fridges are permitted providing they are:
	adequately ventilated
	6.0 cu. ft. or less in size
	plugged directly into a wall outlet.
Students may bring their own or rent from the refrigerator leasing company under contract with Rensselaer.

Miscellaneous Items

Bed risers
Privacy bed tents
Firearms (including antique guns), explosives and other weapons, ammunition, fireworks, starting pistols, incendiary or toxic chemicals, paintball equipment, air rifles, bb pellets, dart guns, torches, stun guns, swords, knives, or any other type of weapon or projectile-firing device. The use of pepper aerosol spray for anything other than self-defense purposes is prohibited
Pets (except fish with a 10 gallon tank size limit); registered service animals, and emotional support animals (that have been approved by Student Health Services) are exempt
Gasoline/fuel powered engines and parts
